definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
